title: Normal
features: "The truth is I hurt people. It's what I do. It's
I do. It's all I've ever done."

He lives on your street, in a nice house with a tidy garden. He shops at your local supermarket. He drives beside you on the highway, waving to let you into the lane ahead of him. He also has an elaborate cage in a secret basement under his garage. The food he's carefully shopping for is to feed a young woman he's holding there against her will—one in a string of many, unaware of the fate that awaits her. This is how it's been for a long time. It's
…and it works. Perfectly. But this time it's different…
description: "Hypnotic and chilling-you won't forget this in a hurry."-Lee Child, #1 New York Times bestselling author"This is simply a brilliant book-utterly compelling and unforgettable. I loved it."-Jamie Mason, author of Three Graves Full and Monday's Lie"A black comedy... A painfully funny story."-Kirkus Reviews"Blackly humorous."-Publishers Weekly"Normal is a wild and fun yet serious debut sure to garner many fans."-The Oklahoman"Brilliant...original and hilarious... This is a book that will have you rooting for a psychopath and hating yourself for it."-BN.com
Graeme Cameron lives with his family in Norfolk, UK. Normal is his first novel.
